channel.title: Unable To Edit Files In Root Directories
channel.description: I am using Whonix as development OS. I need to be able to edit, copy and paste files into the root directories to configure software. For example I need to paste sites-available in /etc/nginx/ but the files open as read only and I cant paste into any folders outside of /home/ that I've tried. On other Linux distros I use sudo nautilus and edit files as root but Whonix says there is no nautilus so I have no idea how to change these files.

item.title: Unable To Edit Files In Root Directories
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HiddenDev:

So if nautilus isnt installed then whats the file manager?

Patrick:

thunar

Excuse my brevity due to lack of time on my side. If parts of my post are unclear, please kindly use search engines. By putting thunar into a search engine, you’ll find out what that is.

Read full topic
item.source: Unable To Edit Files In Root Directories

  • lxsudo thunar
  • sudo apt install nautilus

item.title: Unable To Edit Files In Root Directories
item.dc:creator: HiddenDev
item.description:
I am using Whonix as development OS. I need to be able to edit, copy and paste files into the root directories to configure software. For example I need to paste sites-available in /etc/nginx/ but the files open as read only and I cant paste into any folders outside of /home/ that I’ve tried. On other Linux distros I use sudo nautilus and edit files as root but Whonix says there is no nautilus so I have no idea how to change these files.
